author: Staff Reporter
text:
The 15{+t}{+h}graduation day of the self-financed stream of Madras Christian College in East Tambaram was held on Monday with over 600 graduates, 170 post-graduates and 16 M. Phil scholars receiving their certificates.

In his address, former Chief Secretary of Tripura, B.S. Raghavan said the graduates have to cope up with six revolutions – knowledge, communication, technological management and governance, socio-cum-sociological and the revolution of rising expectations.

College Principal, R.W. Alexander Jesudasan presented the annual report.

MCC alumni association president K.M. Mammen was present.
title: 15th convocation of MCC’s self-financing stream held
